Comments_List: General knowledge of ship and submarine systems, especially those dealing with electrical and power management, were strengthened, as well as overall ship design and administrative structure.

The biggest strength was having the 20+ years of experience provided by the instructor, specifically including years from his enlistment as a Machinist-Mate on submarines. Alongside the general approachability and overall organization of the class, there weren't any weaknesses I can think of outside of the lack of Yale credit for the course.

Absolutely, if you have any interest in ship design and how the United States Navy structures it's vessels, you should take this class. Again, hard to recommend to non-NROTC students due to the lack of Yale class credit.
